Rating:

posts.post_content:
Dear god, an aspect of this card that is not getting enough attention is how hard it is to destroy.   
"Don't worry, I'll naturalize this thing immediately! Oh bollocks, it appears my naturalize turned into a lightning bolt/(any instant in your deck) as I was casting it, we might have a problem here."   
Play in EDH at your own risk, as it might really make people dislike you for turning their elaborate strategy game into ocmplete chaos.   
Any combos you make with this you have to set up before you cast this, otherwise your [long term plans](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=long term plans) or likewise spell will turn into something else.   
It is one of the most chaotic cards ever printed, think twice before you throw it into a deck, as it can pretty much single handedly turn the game into a very random thing where strategy goes out the window, but if you're one of those disruption loving Johnnies/ Random loving Timmies, this card should make you drool.
posts.html:

Any combos you make with this you have to set up before you cast this, otherwise your long term plans or likewise spell will turn into something else.
It is one of the most chaotic cards ever printed, think twice before you throw it into a deck, as it can pretty much single handedly turn the game into a very random thing where strategy goes out the window, but if you're one of those disruption loving Johnnies/ Random loving Timmies, this card should make you drool.

posts.post_content:
I had one epic EDH game where this became my saving grace.   
  
On the field, I had [Grip of Chaos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grip of Chaos), [Ensnaring Bridge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ensnaring Bridge), and [Timesifter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Timesifter) out. As the game went on, it became very clear that none of those permanents were going to die.   
  
See, my friend had a [Naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Naturalize) in his hand soon after I played these three. He, unlike me and my other friend, had very low-CMC spells. So out of the 20 or so TImesifter turns, he only had 2. He became quickly frustrated since he couldn't stop this.  
  
Every time one of us played a spell, it would go to the Possibility Storm. One of them played a [Blue Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blue Sun's Zenith) for ![0](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=0&type=symbol) and got [Reins of Power](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reins of Power) (which did nothing important). I played a [No Mercy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=No Mercy) which turned into a [Bloodchief Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodchief Ascension). Regardless of he amount of turns we all got, almost nothing productive happened. A shame that one of them Storm'd i... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
The obligatory red Johnny card, and I love it. :) I played against a younger player who ran this in his DGR draft deck, and it was hilarious. It didn't do him any good, but we had a blast while it was out. Heh .. literally? One time I cast an instant of some kind and flipped [Blast of Genius](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blast of Genius) ... as the second-to-last card in my library.  
  
I thought maybe you could do something silly with this and [Knowledge Pool](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knowledge Pool), but I don't think it's quite as goofy as I thought it might be.  
  
But yeah, playing this with [Curse of Exhaustion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Curse of Exhaustion) is kind of a jerk thing to do, but it works pretty well, doesn't it?  
  
Ah, the possibilities... :3
posts.html:
The obligatory red Johnny card, and I love it. :) I played against a younger player who ran this in his DGR draft deck, and it was hilarious. It didn't do him any good, but we had a blast while it was out. Heh .. literally? One time I cast an instant of some kind and flipped Blast of Genius ... as the second-to-last card in my library.

I thought maybe you could do something silly with this and Knowledge Pool, but I don't think it's quite as goofy as I thought it might be.

But yeah, playing this with Curse of Exhaustion is kind of a jerk thing to do, but it works pretty well, doesn't it?

Ah, the possibilities... :3
